p: The cohort participants were followed closely for all febrile illnesses, and children and their relatives who also had fever were screened clinically and by laboratory testing, for signs and symptoms of dengue. The surveillance system identified suspected or probable dengue cases that were clinically and serologically studied to confirm dengue infection. During school vacation (July-August and December-March), children were visited or contacted weekly at their homes. During the annual follow-up visits, the field team collected blood samples from all the participants of the study who consented to give the blood sample in order to detect inapparent infections in the cohort.
